Breaststroke.title: Breaststroke Technique
Breaststroke.content: Breaststroke is a swimming stroke where the swimmer is on their chest and moves their arms in a half-circle motion while kicking with a frog-like kick.

Freestyle.title: Freestyle Technique
Freestyle.content: Freestyle, also known as front crawl, is the fastest swimming stroke, where the swimmer alternates their arms while flutter kicking.

Backstroke.title: Backstroke Technique
Backstroke.content: Backstroke is a stroke where the swimmer lies on their back and alternates arm movements while performing a flutter kick. It is the only stroke swum on the back.

Butterfly.title: Butterfly Stroke Technique
Butterfly.content: The butterfly stroke is a fast, dynamic swimming stroke that involves both arms moving in a circular motion while performing a dolphin kick.

Individual Medley (IM).title: Individual Medley (IM) Technique
Individual Medley (IM).content: The Individual Medley (IM) is a race where the swimmer swims all four strokes in the following order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke, and freestyle.

Medley Relay.title: Medley Relay Technique
Medley Relay.content: The Medley Relay involves four swimmers, each swimming one of the four strokes (butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke, and freestyle) in the IM order.

Open Water Swimming.title: Open Water Swimming Technique
Open Water Swimming.content: Open water swimming takes place in natural bodies of water. Techniques include sighting and endurance, with swimmers typically using the freestyle stroke.

Kick Drills.title: Kick Drills Technique
Kick Drills.content: Kick drills are essential for improving leg strength and kicking technique for all strokes. These drills focus on developing efficient kicks.

Pull Drills.title: Pull Drills Technique
Pull Drills.content: Pull drills focus on arm movements and technique, helping to build upper body strength and improve stroke efficiency for all strokes.

Starts.title: Swimming Starts Technique
Starts.content: The start is crucial in competitive swimming. A strong, quick start helps swimmers gain an early advantage. Key techniques include diving and underwater swimming.

Turns.title: Swimming Turns Technique
Turns.content: Swimming turns are a critical part of race strategy. A fast, efficient turn can save valuable time during a race.

Endurance Training.title: Endurance Training for Swimming
Endurance Training.content: Endurance training is crucial for long-distance swimmers. It involves building stamina through consistent practice and interval training.

Speed Training.title: Speed Training for Swimming
Speed Training.content: Speed training helps swimmers develop explosive power and fast-twitch muscle fibers. It focuses on short bursts of intense effort.

Recovery.title: Swimming Recovery Techniques
Recovery.content: Recovery is vital after intense swimming sessions. Techniques include stretching, hydration, and rest to prevent injury and aid in muscle repair.

Mental Techniques.title: Mental Techniques for Swimmers
Mental Techniques.content: Mental techniques like visualization and positive self-talk help swimmers stay focused and calm during races.
